description: A leading trial attorney who helped file US antitrust lawsuits against Alphabet Inc.’s Google and Apple Inc. is set to be named the top competition lawyer at the Federal Trade Commission, according to people familiar with the plans.
title: DOJ Lawyer From Google Advertising Case Picked for Key FTC Job

description: President Donald Trump questioned Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell’s decision making on interest rates and said he planned to speak to the central bank chief “at the right time.”
title: Trump Says He Knows Interest Rates Better Than Fed Chief Powell

description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, Politics editor Laura Davison looks at President Donald Trump’s message to global leaders at the World Economic Forum. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Trump Gives Leaders at Davos a Taste of His Political Campaign

description: Republican senators are scrambling to get President Donald Trump’s cabinet appointees confirmed, promising to vote through the weekend if necessary.
title: Trump’s Cabinet Picks: Where They Stand in the Confirmation Process

description: Texas wants its money back.
title: Texas Demands $11 Billion Reimbursement for Border Security Plan

description: President Donald Trump revoked security details for former Secretary of State Mike Pompeo and two other former top aides, reversing a Biden administration move to protect them from threats that stemmed from policies they enacted during Trump’s first term.
title: Trump Revokes Security From Former Top Aides Despite Iran Threats

description: President Donald Trump signed an executive order he said would declassify documents related to the assassinations of US President John F. Kennedy, Senator Robert Kennedy and civil rights leader Martin Luther King Jr.
title: Trump Orders JFK, RFK, MLK Assassination Documents Released

description: President Donald Trump signed executive actions related to cryptocurrency and artificial intelligence, moves that could bolster two nascent industries.
title: Trump Signs Executive Actions Related to Cryptocurrency, AI

description: The US reversal on climate change will have “a big influence” on discussions at the global summit, said COP30 President Andre Correa do Lago.
title: Trump’s Exit From Paris Accord Will Make COP30 ‘Difficult,’ Brazil Official Says

description: Jared Kushner’s Affinity Partners could join Abu Dhabi-based developer Eagle Hills’ project in Hungary, Vsquare reported, citing a source close to Prime Minister Viktor Orban’s government.
title: Kushner’s Affinity to Join Hungary’s ‘Mini Dubai’, Vsquare Reports

description: Former President Jair Bolsonaro said he won’t flee Brazil if sentenced to prison, a week after a judge barred him from traveling to Donald Trump’s inauguration amid investigations into an alleged coup attempt.
title: Bolsonaro Vows Not to Flee If Brazil Court Sends Him to Jail

description: The Senate overwhelmingly confirmed John Ratcliffe as director of the Central Intelligence Agency, installing another core member of President Donald Trump’s national security team.
title: Trump CIA Director Pick John Ratcliffe Confirmed by US Senate

description: Defense Secretary nominee Pete Hegseth cleared a crucial Senate procedural hurdle despite new allegations of abusing a former wife, signaling likely support for his confirmation.
title: Pete Hegseth Clears Key Senate Vote Despite New Abuse Allegations

description: President Donald Trump’s executive orders against “illegal” diversity, equity and inclusion policies have left corporations and their lawyers struggling to grasp exactly what that means.
title: Trump’s Attack on ‘Illegal’ DEI Disorients Corporate America

description: Brazil’s government is weighing measures such as providing reduced-cost food products through a network of stores in an attempt to combat inflation and boost President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva’s popularity.
title: Brazil Mulls Network of Big Food Discounts to Boost Lula’s Popularity

description: The European Union is set to buy time in its case against China at the World Trade Organization over allegations of economic coercion targeting Lithuania, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: EU Set to Play for Time in Economic Coercion Case Against China

description: A federal judge has temporarily blocked President Donald Trump from restricting who is eligible for automatic US citizenship at birth, in an early legal setback for the new administration’s hard-line immigration agenda.
title: Judge Temporarily Blocks Trump Birthright Citizenship Order

description: The Trump administration’s freeze on some government work and communications on health topics pending a political review is alarming the nation’s scientists, who say the move could delay essential information and slow funding for potentially life-saving initiatives.
title: Trump Alarms Scientists by Muzzling US Health Agencies

description: Claudia Sheinbaum’s efforts to blunt Donald Trump’s relentless targeting of Mexico are winning admirers in Brazil, inspiring one of her allies to consider mimicking her approach to the combative US leader.
title: Lula Advisers Aim to Mimic Sheinbaum’s ‘Cool’ Approach to Trump

description: President Donald Trump sought to dial up pressure on President Vladimir Putin to negotiate a deal to end Russia’s war on Ukraine by indicating he’s seeking to partner with China to try to reach a settlement.
title: Trump Looks to China to Help Press Putin Into a Deal to End War

description: Brooke Rollins, Donald Trump’s nominee for agriculture secretary, supports the president’s plan of “a mass deportation at a scale that matters,” a move that could hurt US farmers who are heavily reliant on foreign labor.
title: Agriculture Secretary Nominee Backs Trump Mass Deportation Plan

description: President Donald Trump levied a surprise broadside against Bank of America Corp.’s Brian Moynihan, chiding the CEO and catching him off-guard, accusing his lender of limiting business with conservative clients.
title: Trump Tells BofA’s Moynihan to Stop Blocking Conservatives

description: The Trump administration is considering hedge fund veteran and China hawk Kyle Bass for a post at either the Treasury or Defense Department, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: Trump Team Considering Kyle Bass for a Treasury or Defense Role

description: Peru is facing its worst public safety crisis in recent memory, with top government officials blaming transnational criminal organizations for the chaos and violence that’s also roiling neighbors Ecuador and Colombia.
title: Peru Sees Crime Surge Tied to Transnational Gangs Roiling Region

description: The French government expects a planned levy to counter tax optimization by the richest individuals to raise €2 billion ($2.1 billion) this year, according to Finance Ministry officials.
title: France to Raise €2 Billion From High Earners in 2025 Budget

description: President Donald Trump said he would ask Saudi Arabia and other OPEC nations to “bring down the cost of oil” and reiterated his threat to use tariffs to bring manufacturing back to the US as he addressed world leaders gathered in Davos on Thursday.
title: Trump Urges Lower Oil Prices, Interest Rate Cuts at Davos

description: Switzerland’s finance minister is concerned that the economic slump in the European Union and Germany will also hit Swiss companies, as both are among the most important trading partners of the country.
title: Europe’s Economic Slump Has Swiss Worried, Finance Chief Says

description: Rebuilding homes destroyed by wildfires in the Los Angeles area could take more than a year to even begin — and that’s if everything goes smoothly, according to Rick Caruso, a billionaire developer and former mayoral candidate who says city leaders failed to protect lives and property.
title: Billionaire Developer Caruso Slams LA Leadership Over Wildfires

description: President Sheinbaum is under pressure to reduce Mexican reliance on US fuel
title: Mexico’s $20 Billion Refinery Flops as Trump Threatens Oil Tariffs

description: Friedrich Merz, the conservative front-runner in the race to be Germany’s next chancellor, warned domestic companies against making bigger investments in China.
title: German Frontrunner Merz Warns Companies Against China Investment

description: Bulgaria’s newly formed government will hold off taking the next step toward adopting the euro until the Balkan nation formally meets European Union requirements.
title: Bulgaria Tempers Euro Adoption Push on Inflation Criterion Miss

description: South African President Cyril Ramaphosa assented to a new law that makes it easier for the state to expropriate land in the public interest, subject to equitable compensation being paid.
title: South African President Signs Off on Land-Expropriation Law

description: Saudi Arabia has investments of more than $770 billion in the US and said it expects relations with Washington “will continue to be flourishing” as the kingdom pursues its broad economic overhaul.
title: Saudi Arabia Says $770 Billion Invested in US as MBS Eyes More

description: Canadian consumers appear to have embraced falling interest rates and ended the holiday season with the strongest spending in nearly two years.
title: Canada Retail Sales Likely Jumped in December on Tax Break

description: Denmark’s defense minister wants to raise the Nordic country’s total military spending to more than 500 billion kroner ($70 billion) through 2033 as it seeks to ramp up investment in security in the Arctic region.
title: Denmark Wants to Spend More on Greenland Defense Amid Trump Spat

description: Micheal Martin, leader of Ireland’s Fianna Fail party, was voted in as prime minister on Thursday after an election in November that saw the main incumbent coalition partners return to power.
title: Ireland’s Martin Returns as Prime Minister for Second Term

description: Iceland is crowdsourcing ideas from the population on budget savings to ensure taxpayer money is well spent, Finance Minister Dadi Mar Kristofersson said.
title: Iceland Is Crowdsourcing Ways to Cut State Spending

description: President Donald Trump’s nominee to oversee American farming was once head of a group that was among the loudest opponents of a favorite US agriculture product: biofuels.
title: Trump’s Agriculture Pick Set for Senate Hot Seat Over Biofuels

description: Top diplomats from China and India will meet next week in Beijing as the nuclear-armed neighbors try to repair ties marred by a border dispute nearly five years ago.
title: India, China Diplomats to Meet in Beijing to Pursue Better Ties

description: Communities in the rural South dangle millions in tax breaks to lure the Texas chain.
title: Forget Factories, Small US Towns Want Buc-ee’s Gas Stations

description: Iraq is concerned about a potential resurgence of Islamic State in neighboring Syria and believes only a credible and inclusive political process will bring security to the country after the overthrow of former President Bashar Al-Assad.
title: Iraq Wary of Resurgence of Islamic State in Post-Assad Syria

description: Friedrich Merz, the conservative front-runner in the race for Germany’s chancellorship, called for a radical overhaul of the country’s migration policy including permanent border checks. The comments come after an asylum seeker from Afghanistan was taken into custody over a fatal stabbing of a two-year-old child and a man in a park on Wednesday.
title: Germany’s Leading Candidate Calls for Permanent Border Checks

description: Egypt is “cautiously optimistic” a ceasefire between Israel and Hamas will eventually translate into a recovery in Suez Canal revenue, which fell at least 60% due to the war, the country’s minister for foreign trade and investment said.
title: Egypt Cautiously Optimistic Suez Canal Traffic Will Revive, Minister Says

description: The European Union indicated that it would be open to the UK joining a pan-European customs program that also takes in parts of the Middle East and Africa as part of Prime Minister Keir Starmer’s “reset” talks with the bloc.
title: EU Opens Door for UK to Join Pan-Europe Customs Program

description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.
title: Putin and Zelenskiy Vie to Sway Trump Over War in Ukraine

description: Slovak President Peter Pellegrini said there’s no need to declare a state of emergency even after the premier suggested some groups had attempted to organize a “coup.”
title: President Sees No Need to Declare State of Emergency in Slovakia

description: The European Union will propose establishing an advanced research project agency modeled on US government entities to invest in strategic technologies as part of a broader drive to boost the bloc’s competitiveness.
title: EU to Bet on AI, Advanced Research and Clean Tech in Bid to Compete

description: The fate of the European Union’s sanctions against Russia were thrown into limbo after a top Hungarian official called for a “debate” and signaled their renewal by the end of the month shouldn’t be automatic.
title: EU Russia Sanctions in Limbo as Orban Aide Calls for ‘Debate’

description: NATO Secretary General Mark Rutte gave his full-throated backing to US President Donald Trump’s pressure campaign against Russia aimed at halting its war on Ukraine.
title: NATO’s Rutte Says Trump’s Pressure on Putin Is ‘Way Forward’

description: Indonesia, a major supplier of liquefied natural gas, is asking its overseas buyers to accept delays to some scheduled shipments as domestic energy demand rises.
title: Indonesia Seeks to Delay Some LNG Exports to Meet Domestic Needs

description: Gabon’s junta-led government said it will hold presidential elections on April 12, raising the prospects for a return to civilian rule. The country’s sovereign dollar bonds rallied.
title: OPEC-Member Gabon’s Junta Leader Sets April Election Date

description: President Donald Trump spent the first days of his return to the White House sharing the spoils of victory with his most loyal followers and offering up red meat culture war wins with the stroke of his pen.
title: Trump Maps Pivot From Quick Wins to Harder, ‘Solvable’ Problems

description: The ski resort hotel that burned down in northern Turkey on Tuesday lacked even the most basic precautions against fires, Hurriyet newspaper reported, as the death toll increased to 78.
title: Hotel in Turkey Fire Lacked Basic Safety Measures, Hurriyet Says

description: Oil refiners in India are reaching for all available options in the rush to make up for Russian flows hit by Washington’s latest round of sanctions, turning to the spot market while simultaneously seeking more long-term supplies from Middle Eastern producers.
title: India Oil Buyers Pull All Levers to Replace Russian Shipments

description: The most coveted seat in Davos on Thursday will be in the plenary when US President Donald Trump delivers a remote address to attendees that will be piped into the main hall via a remote link.
title: Schwarzman, Moynihan and Botin to Quiz Trump During Davos Speech

description: Singapore has charged Wang Junjie, the former director of a local corporate service provider linked to individuals caught up in the city-state’s record S$3 billion ($2.2 billion) money-laundering case.
title: Singapore Charges Former Director in Record Laundering Case

description: Taiwan’s ruling party is asking the highest court to pause and potentially throw out legislation that may limit the judiciary’s ability to function, a move that could give President Lai Ching-te a big win in his battles with the opposition over issues including the budget and defense spending to deter China.
title: Taiwan’s Ruling Party Challenges Revamp of Key High Court

description: Gulf countries used the weeklong event in the Swiss Alps to showcase their ambitions to become even more relevant on the global stage.
title: Mideast Billions Turn Heads in Davos, From Blackstone to Beckham

description: South Korean anti-corruption agency wrapped up a preliminary investigation into President Yoon Suk Yeol over his ill-fated martial law declaration, and asked prosecutors to indict the impeached leader on charges of insurrection.
title: South Korea Probe Team Seeks Indictment of Yoon Over Martial Law

description: Qatar’s success in helping to broker the long-awaited Gaza ceasefire has enhanced its reputation as an international mediator, with officials now considering which other conflicts they could help resolve.
title: Qatar Sees Gaza Role as Springboard to Brokering Other Conflicts

description: The acting head of the US Justice Department threatened employees with “adverse consequences” if they fail to report diversity and inclusion programs, following President Donald Trump’s move to eliminate DEI initiatives across the federal government.
title: DOJ Memo Warns Staff of ‘Adverse Consequences’ Over DEI Programs

description: President Donald Trump proposed turning disaster assistance over to individual states to distribute rather than having the Federal Emergency Management Agency respond, ahead of a trip to survey flood damage in North Carolina and wildfires in California.
title: Trump Floats States, Not FEMA, Handle Emergency Response

description: President Donald Trump downplayed the national security risk posed by TikTok in an interview with Fox News on Wednesday, days after offering the social video app a reprieve from legislation that would have forced it to shut down.
title: Trump Downplays Threat of China Using TikTok to Spy on Americans

description: Secretary of State Marco Rubio plans to travel to Panama as part of a trip to Latin America as soon as next week, a person familiar with the matter said, underscoring President Donald Trump’s seriousness about taking back the Panama Canal.
title: Rubio Plans to Visit Panama in First Trip as Trump Eyes Canal

description: President Donald Trump has chosen Sean Curran, the agent in charge of his security detail during the 2024 campaign, to be the new director of the US Secret Service, an organization under intense scrutiny following two failed assassination attempts against the then-Republican candidate.
title: Trump Taps Head of Security Detail as Secret Service Director

description: He’s not showing up in person, and his video address will come as the World Economic Forum is already winding down. But Donald Trump is still what everyone wants to talk about in Davos.
title: One by One, World Leaders in Davos Fall in Line in Trump Era

description: China, Thailand and other nations have reached a deal to target cybercrime centers that have taken root in Southeast Asian nations — a sign the governments are keen to crack down on gangs stealing millions of dollars from their people and damaging tourism.
title: China, Southeast Asian Nations Pledge to Deal With Scam Centers

description: Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed Bin Salman told President Donald Trump that his country is willing to expand its investments and trade with the US in the coming four years by $600 billion, or even more if opportunities arose, according to the state-run news agency SPA.
title: Saudi Leader Offers $600 Billion Investment Pledge in Trump Call

description: President Donald Trump signed an order on Wednesday that again would categorize the Houthi militant group in Yemen as a terrorist organization — nearly four years after the Biden administration revoked the designation.
title: Trump Will Again Designate Houthis as Terrorists, Reversing Biden

description: Prime Minister Keir Starmer has announced plans to prevent legal challenges from causing delays to major infrastructure projects, in the latest effort by the UK government to convince investors and businesses that it is serious about pursuing economic growth.
title: Starmer to Curb UK Court Challenges to ‘Disarm the NIMBYs’
